# Request for Proposal: Custom Mirrors for the Subaru Telescope Pathfinder Instrument and the Gemini Planet Imager

## Request Summary

The National Research Council Canada (NRC) Herzberg Astronomy and Astrophysics Research Center (HAA) has a requirement for two custom off-axis ellipsoid (OAE) mirrors and one custom off-axis parabola (OAP) mirror for the Subaru Telescope Pathfinder Instrument for Detecting Exoplanets and Retrieving Spectra (SPIDERS) project and the Gemini Planet Imager (GPI) instrument, respectively. The delivery is required in Victoria, British Columbia.

## Evaluation and Procurement

- Procurement Method: Competitive - Open Bidding
- Process: Bidders must meet all mandatory criteria described in the Request for Proposal.
- Selection Criteria: Lowest Price

## Contract Terms

- Contracting Entity: National Research Council Canada (NRC)
- Trade Agreements: Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
- Taxes and Customs Duties: Excluded

## Submissions

- Format: Bidders must submit fixed unit prices in Canadian currency.
- Enquiries: Written submissions to Wendy Semegen, Senior Contracting Officer, must be received at least 7 calendar days prior to the bid closing date.

## Deliverables

- Two (2) custom OAE mirrors for the SPIDERS project
- One (1) custom OAP mirror for the GPI instrument

## Closing Date and Time

- 2024-07-10T14:00:00
- Locally in Victoria, British Columbia

## Attachments

The Request for Proposal, including amendments, is available for download.
